I don’t only remember Lost as being great entertainment but as being a great part of my life as I looked forward to it, watched it, talked about it and theorised with my friends. Something about this show really hit the spot for me, as it did for a lot of people and as no other TV show or movie has since.

So I’ve started watching it again from the beginning with Anne, who hasn’t seen a single episode.

I knew there’d be many extra things I’d pick up on having already been through the series once but there was a beautiful moment in season 1, episode 2 when Locke is teaching backgammon to Walt. He holds up the pieces and explains, “two sides, one is light, one is dark” followed by a long pause. This would become the theme through the next 100 episodes.
